content:
I apologize, but I don't have that specific information on the battery sizes of the electric heavy-duty trucks I listed. However, I can provide you with some general information on battery size.
The battery size of electric vehicles is typically measured in kilowatt-hours (kWh), which is a measure of the energy stored in the battery. A higher kWh rating generally means that the vehicle has a larger battery and therefore a longer range.
For example:

* Tesla Semi has a battery pack of 1.2MWh, 4 battery packs of energy storage.
* Rivian R1T has a battery pack of 180 kWh, 135 kWh and 105 kWh options.
* Nikola Two has a battery pack of 600kWh - 800kWh
* Daimler eCascadia, Volvo VNR Electric and Freightliner eCascadia have not provided details yet
* Peterbilt Model 579 EV has a battery pack of up to 525 kWh
* Kenworth T680E has a battery pack of up to 475 kWh
* Mack LR Electric has a battery pack of up to 425 kWh
* Fuso eCanter has a battery pack of 82kWh

Please keep in mind that these values can vary depending on the configuration of the vehicle and the manufacturer. Also, some manufacturers have not provided the exact battery size yet, and might change as the production and delivery date of the vehicles are approaching.
